data.qǝʍᴉʍǝp#qǝʍᴉʍǝp:
Stage manager based in Rennes, France. I work in live performance while developing open source tools at the intersection of digital and stage production.
My projects revolve around spatial audio, control protocols (OSC, Ember+, MIDI/XCTL) and practical utilities for production.
What I do Live performance — Stage manager by training and practice, with a technical approach to the stage and production workflow Open source development — Active contributor on GitHub since 2013, projects in JavaScript, TypeScript, Rust, Python and C Technical integration — Specialised in interfacing stage and audiovisual equipment via open protocols Links GitHub — github.com/dewiweb Initiated projects Contributions

data: These are the repositories I created and maintain. They mainly cover spatial audio, stage control protocols and utility tools.
Projects around 3D audio, immersive sound and tools for driving spatialisation systems.

data.features#Features: Linux kernel module (Loadable Kernel Module) RAVENNA/AES67 audio transport over IP Native ALSA integration Compatible with Merging Technologies equipment and other AES67 devices
data.links#Links: GitHub repository Original source (Merging Technologies) Language: C Topics: aes67 alsa driver linux
data.overview#Overview:
Clone of the ALSA RAVENNA/AES67 driver originally provided by Merging Technologies. This Linux kernel module (LKM) enables the RAVENNA network audio transport protocol (compatible with AES67) within the ALSA subsystem on Linux.
RAVENNA/AES67 is a professional audio-over-IP transport standard used in studios, concert halls and broadcast installations.

data.features#Features: Control Holophonix sources from Chataigne Bidirectional OSC communication Integration into show control workflows
data.overview#Overview: A Python module integrating the Holophonix spatial audio processor into Chataigne — a modular software for arts and technology. Drives spatial sound sources from Chataigne’s interface via OSC.

data.features#Features: Create movement behaviours (circles, lines, free trajectories) Manage multiple tracks simultaneously OSC synchronisation with Holophonix Desktop GUI (Electron/Node.js)
data.overview#Overview:
Desktop application for creating and managing movement animations for spatial audio tracks on the Holophonix processor.
It communicates with Holophonix via the OSC protocol and lets you define trajectories and dynamic behaviours for sound sources in 3D space.

data.features#Features: Control Holophonix spatial audio sources from Chataigne Read/write parameters via OSC Integration into complex show control workflows Compatible with recent Holophonix versions
data.overview#Overview: A Chataigne module dedicated to the Holophonix spatial audio processor. Natively integrates Holophonix into Chataigne to drive sound sources, read states and automate behaviours in a show control context.

data.features#Features: Read 6DoF data (X/Y/Z translation + rotation) from the SpaceMouse Convert and send data as OSC messages Configurable mappings (axes, OSC addresses, value ranges) Low latency for real-time control
data.links#Links: GitHub repository Language: JavaScript Licence: MIT Topics: 3dconnexion 6dof osc spacemouse spatial-audio
data.overview#Overview:
Bridge between the 3Dconnexion SpaceMouse Compact and the OSC (Open Sound Control) protocol. Lets you use the 6DoF (6 degrees of freedom) controller to drive sound sources in 3D space in real time.
Particularly well suited to controlling spatialisation systems such as Holophonix, Max/MSP or SuperCollider.

data.features#Features: GUI for defining movement trajectories Real-time OSC output Modern TypeScript architecture Compatible with OSC systems (Holophonix, Max/MSP, etc.)
data.overview#Overview:
Full rewrite of the Trajectoires application, a web/mobile interface for controlling sound spatialisation via OSC. This modernised version is developed in TypeScript with a revised architecture.
Trajectoires lets you draw and animate trajectories for sound sources in space, then send them in real time to a spatialisation system.

data.features#Features: Autoplay on boot Supports: video, PDF, PowerPoint (converted), image slideshows Load from USB stick or local storage Chromium in kiosk mode (full-screen, no UI) Simple configuration
data.overview#Overview:
A plug-and-play solution to turn any Raspberry Pi into a full-screen media kiosk player. Automatically plays videos, PowerPoint presentations, PDFs and image slideshows from a USB stick or local storage — all rendered via Chromium.
Ideal for installations, exhibitions, digital signage or any stage use case requiring automatic media playback.
data.requirements#Requirements: Raspberry Pi (any recent generation) Raspberry Pi OS Chromium (included by default on Raspberry Pi OS)

data: Projects around protocols used to interconnect stage equipment: OSC, Ember+, XCTL.

data.features#Features: Ember+ client (consumer) implementation Ember+ server (provider) implementation Written in Rust (performance, memory safety)
data.overview#Overview:
A Rust implementation of the Ember+ protocol, covering both the client (consumer) and server (provider) roles.
Ember+ is a control protocol used in the broadcast and audiovisual industry for communication between equipment (mixers, routers, monitoring systems…).
data.why-rust#Why Rust?: Rust provides excellent memory-safety guarantees and performance for a low-level protocol like Ember+, which requires reliable, low-latency communication.

data.features#Features: Bidirectional Ember+ ↔ OSC translation Adapted to Lawo MCx console specifics Interfacing with show control systems via OSC
data.overview#Overview: A bridge between the Ember+ and OSC protocols, specifically designed for Lawo MCx consoles. Allows controlling and monitoring an MCx console from any OSC environment (Chataigne, Max/MSP, QLab, etc.).

data.features#Features: Ember+ ↔ OSC bridge with improved architecture Better error handling and automatic reconnection Compatible with any Ember+ device, not only Lawo MCx
data.overview#Overview: A rewrite and evolution of MCxOSC — an Ember+ to OSC bridge. Revised architecture for greater robustness and flexibility, compatible with a wider range of Ember+ equipment.

data.contents#Contents: XCTL message structure Control mapping (faders, encoders, buttons, LEDs, displays) JavaScript implementation examples Comparison with HUI and Mackie Control protocols
data.links#Links: GitHub repository Online documentation Language: JavaScript Licence: GPL-3.0
data.overview#Overview:
Reference documentation for the XCTL protocol used by Behringer X-Touch mixing consoles (and compatible surfaces). This MIDI-extended protocol enables bidirectional communication between the control surface and a DAW or custom control system.
This repository collects information gathered through reverse engineering and community documentation — officially undocumented by Behringer.
